verses.verse: “But My people would not heed My voice, And Israel would have (Ex. 32:1; Deut. 32:15) none of Me.
((Job 8:4; Acts 7:42; Rom. 1:24, 26)) So I gave them over to their own stubborn heart, To walk in their own counsels.
“Oh, ((Deut. 5:29; Is. 48:18)) that My people would listen to Me, That Israel would walk in My ways!
I would soon subdue their enemies, And turn My hand against their adversaries.
(Rom. 1:30) The haters of the LORD would pretend submission to Him, But their fate would endure forever.
He would (Deut. 32:14) have fed them also with the finest of wheat; And with honey (Job 29:6) from the rock I would have satisfied you.”
(A Plea for Justice) A Psalm of Asaph. [1] God ((2 Chr. 19:6; Eccl. 5:8)) stands in the congregation of the mighty; He judges among (Ps. 82:6) the gods.
How long will you judge unjustly, And ((Deut. 1:17); Prov. 18:5) show partiality to the wicked? Selah
Defend the poor and fatherless; Do justice to the afflicted and ((Deut. 24:17; Is. 11:4; Jer. 22:16)) needy.
Deliver the poor and needy; Free them from the hand of the wicked.
They do not know, nor do they understand; They walk about in darkness; All the (Ps. 11:3) foundations of the earth are unstable.
I said, (John 10:34) “You are gods, And all of you are children of the Most High.
But you shall die like men, And fall like one of the princes.”
Arise, O God, judge the earth; (Ps. 2:8; (Rev. 11:15)) For You shall inherit all nations.
(Prayer to Frustrate Conspiracy Against Israel) A Song. A Psalm of Asaph. [1] Do (Ps. 28:1) not keep silent, O God! Do not hold Your peace, And do not be still, O God!
For behold, (Ps. 81:15; Is. 17:12; Acts 4:25) Your enemies make a tumult; And those who hate You have lifted up their head.
They have taken crafty counsel against Your people, And consulted together ((Ps. 27:5)) against Your sheltered ones.
They have said, “Come, and (Esth. 3:6, 9; Jer. 11:19; 31:36) let us cut them off from being a nation, That the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”
